byline.contributor: Eric Dash contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Citigroup agrees to pay $285 million to settle a civil complaint by the Securities and Exchange Commission that it had defrauded investors who had bought a $1 billion portfolio of mortgage-related investments; Citigroup had failed to let investors know of its role in picking the investments as well as the fact that it had bet that many of them would fall in value.
snippet: The company agreed to settle a complaint by the S.E.C. that it had defrauded buyers in a $1 billion portfolio of mortgage-related investments.
lead_paragraph: The company agreed to settle a complaint by the S.E.C. that it had defrauded buyers in a $1 billion portfolio of mortgage-related investments.

headline.main: Citigroup to Pay Millions to Close Fraud Complaint
